fullText: The musical, which opened Thursday at the Nederlander Theatre, tells the story of John Newton, the 18th-century English sailor and slave trader who wrote the beloved hymn after a spiritual awakening.

With its mostly generic, sometimes bombastic score and stilted dialogue, this account of the pre-American Revolution U.K. can recall some of the more hot-air-filled musicals that invaded us from abroad (and some homegrown ones) in the '80s and '90s.
